translation.en: [man over radio] It's time for the NBA to stop pretending.
Call it the TBA, the Thug Basketball Association.
These guys never had to follow the rules. They are prima donna athletes.
translation.ko: 규칙을 따르는 적이 없습니다 제멋대로인 선수들이죠

translation.en: I couldn't believe what was going on.
It was an iconic brawl.
Unprofessional.
Absolutely unprofessional.
It's hard to explain to people from suburban America.
translation.ko: 교외 사람들은 설명해 줘도 이해를 못 해요

translation.en: Ron Artest just went nuts.
He does have psychological problems.
We ride together, fam!
Stephen Jackson deserved the most severe penalty.
translation.ko: 가장 심한 징계를 받은 건 스티븐 잭슨이었습니다

translation.en: I'm never talking about this shit again. Can you get that on camera?
translation.ko: 이 얘기 다시는 안 해요 이거나 방송에 내보내요

translation.en: It was way too much pressure for me. Way--
I felt I was trying to escape, to find any way to escape.
Pressure on the NBA to clean up its ranks,
translation.ko: NBA는 조직을 다듬어야 한다는 압박을 받고 있죠

translation.en: send a message that these guys are not a bunch of thugs.
If you actually knew what happened,
you actually knew the effects that it had on everybody…
translation.ko: 그 일이 모두에게 미친 영향을 아신다면

translation.en: …you wouldn't even be asking questions.
I want the story out there. What happened? Go frame by frame.
translation.ko: 세상이 알아야 해요 정확히 어떤 일이 있었는지

translation.en: [O'Neal] Show people all the footage.
Then when it's told, you make your own conclusion on what it is.
translation.ko: 직접 보고 나서 각자 결론을 내리게 하자고요

translation.en: All right, all right, all right, I'm good. I can walk!
-Okay, fine. -I can walk!
Okay, all right.
We ride together, fam!
[O'Neal] Once we got to the locker room, I remember just sitting down,
translation.ko: 라커 룸에 들어가서 가만히 앉아 있었어요

translation.en: and I sat there for a while, and I sat…
translation.ko: 유니폼을 입은 채로 한동안 앉아 있었는데

translation.en: I literally sat in my uniform.
translation.ko: 유니폼을 입은 채로 한동안 앉아 있었는데 "저메인 오닐 인디애나 페이서스"

translation.en: And my phone just vibrating. Like, it's going off.
translation.ko: 휴대폰이 울리고 있었어요 아내, 어머니, 형, 친구들이 계속 전화를 걸었고

translation.en: My wife calling me, my mother, my brother, friends calling me.
translation.ko: 아내, 어머니, 형, 친구들이 계속 전화를 걸었고

translation.en: I think I had over a hundred text messages.
My adrenaline's still pumping.
I'm just sitting there trying to calm down, man.
translation.ko: 자리에 앉아서 진정해 보려고 했어요 "스티븐 잭슨 인디애나 페이서스"

translation.en: Just trying to calm down. I'm still in fight mode.
translation.ko: "스티븐 잭슨 인디애나 페이서스" 화가 안 가셨거든요

translation.en: In my head, I'm like, "You're done."
"There's no way-- you might not ever play again."
translation.ko: "메타 월드 피스 인디애나 페이서스" '내 농구 경력은 여기까지야 다른 일을 알아보자'

translation.en: "Start thinking about something else."
translation.ko: '내 농구 경력은 여기까지야 다른 일을 알아보자'

translation.en: Thanks, I appreciate it.
[reporter] A stretcher taking away an injured fan.
An ambulance on the scene with flashing lights and victims inside.
translation.ko: 현장에는 피해자를 실은 구급차가 불을 깜빡이고 있습니다

translation.en: This is what became of the Pistons-Pacers game
at the Palace of Auburn Hills.
But everyone's saying it's a black eye for Detroit
and pointing the finger at some particular Pacers players.
translation.ko: 일부 페이서스 선수들에게도 책임을 묻고 있습니다

translation.en: [O'Neal] When I got home,
I'm up all night looking at this.
[newswoman] We think there have to be special rules in these sports arenas,
translation.ko: 다들 스포츠 경기장에선 뭐든 허용된다고 생각하죠

translation.en: and we think we have to have kid gloves and treat these zillion-dollar athletes
translation.ko: 아이들에게 오냐오냐하듯 거액 연봉을 받는 선수들에게 특별 대우를 해주고 있어요

translation.en: as if they're different and special.
translation.ko: 거액 연봉을 받는 선수들에게 특별 대우를 해주고 있어요

translation.en: Too many players in this league
whose actions and attitudes bespeak kind of a thug mentality.
translation.ko: 그 행동과 태도에서 깡패 기질을 보이고 있어요

translation.en: [O'Neal] I just remember watching TV,
and now I'm thinking about all the work that I put in as a pro player
translation.ko: 그 자리까지 가기 위해 선수로서 쏟았던 노력들이

translation.en: to get to the point I've gotten to.
Everything you worked for,
in a split moment. [snaps fingers]
Getting out of my position of how I grew up in Columbia, South Carolina
put me in a position to look at life differently.
They flew the Confederate flag on the state house
until as recently as three or four years ago.
You make decisions growing up because your environment is that.
translation.ko: 성장 환경에 따라 선택이 좌우될 수밖에 없죠

translation.en: Your environment states that's what you should be doing,
but basketball became that safe haven for me
translation.ko: 하지만 농구가 도피처가 되어 준 덕분에

translation.en: to, you know, not go down the road that many do.
translation.ko: 다들 택하는 험한 길로 빠지지 않을 수 있었어요

translation.en: The National Basketball Association draft of new talent is coming up on Wednesday.
translation.ko: NBA 신예 선수들을 지명하는 드래프트가 수요일에 진행됩니다

translation.en: This year's crop is younger than ever.
[newsman] One high school senior, Jermaine O'Neal, thinks he's ready to play in the NBA.
translation.ko: 고등학교 졸업반 저메인 오닐은 데뷔할 자격이 있다고 자신합니다

translation.en: [announcer] Jermaine O'Neal!
[newsman] O'Neal, an All-American from South Carolina,
has decided to try his luck in the draft.
[O'Neal] I knew it was time to make the jump to the NBA.
translation.ko: NBA로 도약할 때가 됐다는 걸 알고 있었어요

translation.en: I'm the piece that can change the bloodline of my family,
that can break the chains of things
that have been going on over and over and over and over again. I'm that piece.
translation.ko: 악순환의 사슬을 끊을 사람이 바로 나였어요

translation.en: The Portland Trail Blazers select Jermaine O'Neal
translation.ko: 포틀랜드 트레일 블레이저스는 저메인 오닐을 지명합니다

translation.en: from Eau Claire High School in South Carolina.
[O'Neal] I got drafted at 17, picked to the Portland Trail Blazers.
[O'Neal] You get an opportunity to play something
that many people just dream about doing at 17.
translation.ko: 직접 활동하게 된 거죠 그것도 고작 17살에요

translation.en: Right? Just started driving.
But I also remember the boos.
That was one of the things that really motivated me.
translation.ko: 그 소리를 들은 게 엄청난 자극이 되었어요

translation.en: Because people were counting me out.
[commentator] And now Jermaine O'Neal…
[O'Neal] I remember the first time I played in an NBA game.
It's like living a dream.
There ain't nothing like walking into those NBA arenas.
translation.ko: NBA 코트에 오르는 것만큼 짜릿한 기분은 없어요

translation.en: Feeling that energy.
-That hate if you're opposing team. -[boos]
Or that incredible love if you're home team.
translation.ko: 우리 팀 팬들의 무한한 사랑이 느껴지죠

translation.en: -[crowd cheering] -[commentator] Jermaine O'Neal!
I became the youngest player at the time to play an NBA game.
Now I'm going from being the best player on the court in high school
to being the fourth-best person at my position on my own team.
translation.ko: NBA에 가니까 나보다 잘난 사람이 같은 포지션에만 세 명이더군요

translation.en: You never think about not playing. You just don't think about that.
translation.ko: 시합을 못 뛴다는 걱정은 그 전까진 안 해봤어요

translation.en: Because if you do, you're a loser.
But it was like, "Damn, how dare you just not even give me a chance?"
I remember sitting at the end of the bench and tears in my eyes.
translation.ko: 벤치 끝에 앉아서 눈물을 흘리곤 했어요

translation.en: I was like, "Something gotta change."
Well, it was just a couple months ago when the Pacers lost to an O'Neal,
translation.ko: 페이서스는 불과 두 달 전 샤킬 오닐의 팀에 패배했는데

translation.en: but this week, they gained one in Jermaine O'Neal.
translation.ko: 이번 주에 저메인 오닐을 팀원으로 맞았습니다

translation.en: When I got the call that I got traded from Portland to Indiana,
I was so excited. It was an opportunity to play with Reggie Miller.
translation.ko: 레지 밀러와 뛴다는 생각에 매우 들떴어요

translation.en: [chanting] Reggie! Reggie! Reggie!
I'm a die-hard Reggie fan.
I'm here for Reggie. [laughs]
I come to the games because of Reggie. [chuckles]
translation.ko: 레지 아니면 시합 보러 안 와요

translation.en: [O'Neal] I know he's a true competitor. He's a legend.
I told them, "Look, put me right next to his locker.
I need to talk to him."
[commentator] Here's Reggie. Here's the shot!
[Miller] I played 18 years for the Indiana Pacers.
Indiana breathes basketball.
translation.ko: 인디애나는 농구에 살고 농구에 죽는 동네죠

translation.en: They live it.
So, me being a basketball junkie,
I was in heaven.
And I was fortunate that Donnie Walsh,
the president/general manager, took a chance on me.
translation.ko: 도니 월시가 제게 기회를 줬어요 "전미 농구 협회 드래프트 지명"

translation.en: Reggie was the guy that really put the Indiana Pacers
translation.ko: 레지 덕분에 인디애나 페이서스는 "도니 월시 인디애나 페이서스 사장"

translation.en: on a trajectory they had not been on before.
He really wanted to win
and did more than anybody anywhere in attempting to get the championship.
translation.ko: 챔피언십 우승을 위해 그 누구보다도 열심히 했죠

translation.en: Reggie Miller of the Indiana Pacers is here.
translation.ko: 인디애나 페이서스의 레지 밀러가 나와 있습니다

translation.en: He is one of the great basketball players in the NBA.
-Great to have you. Thanks for coming. -Thank you. My pleasure.
Is there more pressure on you this season because of the success of last season?
translation.ko: 지난 시즌의 성공으로 인해 올해는 더 부담되나요?

translation.en: [Miller] I think so. Um…
I-I wanna win the championship.
That is… That is my big goal. We came very close last year.
translation.ko: 그게 제 목표인데 작년에 거의 이룰 뻔했죠

translation.en: [Miller] We got to the finals in 2000, and we lost to the Lakers.
[commentator] Jackson looking to throw it in against Shaq.
Reggie turns and puts it up.
Off the rim, and the Lakers are the NBA champions.
[newsman] We can't help but wonder, how many more chances
translation.ko: 이렇게 되면 궁금해지는군요 위대한 레지 밀러에게는 몇 번의 기회가 남았을까요?

translation.en: for the magnificent Reggie Miller?
translation.ko: 위대한 레지 밀러에게는 몇 번의 기회가 남았을까요?

translation.en: [Miller] That was my 14th year, and we had never won a championship.
translation.ko: 그때가 14년 차였는데 한 번도 우승하지 못했었어요

translation.en: Looking at all the contracts and the age, it was time for us to get younger,
translation.ko: 계약 현황과 평균 나이를 고려하니 어린 선수들이 필요해 보였죠

translation.en: and they made and pulled the plug in getting Jermaine.
translation.ko: 그래서 마음을 단단히 먹고 저메인을 영입했어요

translation.en: [O'Neal] The first day when I got traded,
I was at Champps, downtown Indianapolis.
And I walked in, I heard, "That's the guy we traded Dale Davis for."
translation.ko: 누가 그러더라고요 '데일 데이비스 보내고 쟤를 데려왔대'

translation.en: People were pissed.
They gutted the team.
translation.ko: "경험 부족한 어린 선수 저메인 오닐 영입" 팀을 찢어놨으니까요

translation.en: I was 20 years old.
I've never been in a position to be a starter
every single night,
but I'm willing to sacrifice every single thing I got for this opportunity.
translation.ko: 하지만 이 기회를 잡기 위해 모든 걸 바칠 생각이었어요

translation.en: 100% certain that you guys won't be disappointed at all.
I think you'll be very, very happy the trade was made.
translation.ko: 이번 트레이드에 아주 만족하게 될 겁니다

translation.en: I can bring a lot to the table.
I think Jermaine was really dedicated
translation.ko: 저메인은 자신이 리그에서 손꼽히는 선수라는 걸

translation.en: to trying to prove he was one of the best players in the league.
translation.ko: 저메인은 자신이 리그에서 손꼽히는 선수라는 걸 증명하고 싶었던 것 같아요

translation.en: And he handled himself off the court with that kind of confidence.
You know, he was kinda what the NBA wanted.
I was kinda thinking, not right away, but down the road,
translation.ko: 영입 당시에는 아니어도 나중에는 레지를 대체할 수 있을 것 같았죠

translation.en: maybe he could replace Reggie.
translation.ko: 나중에는 레지를 대체할 수 있을 것 같았죠

translation.en: [Miller] He's definitely showing signs he'd carry this franchise,
translation.ko: 이 팀을 이끌 수 있다는 모습을 보여주고 있어요

translation.en: and what I mean by that is not the numbers he does,
but I think the leadership he brings to a lot of the younger guys in here.
translation.ko: 어린 선수들을 상대로 리더십을 보이고 있죠

translation.en: You have to outwork people. Like, you just gotta be a savage.
translation.ko: 누구보다 더 노력해야 돼요 눈에 뵈는 게 없는 것처럼요

translation.en: [Walsh] Jermaine, to me, was a very unusual player for then.
translation.ko: 제가 아는 저메인은 당시 보기 드문 선수였어요

translation.en: He can do a lot of big man things,
but he can also take people off the dribble, and he was very athletic.
translation.ko: 드리블로 상대를 따돌리기도 하고 운동능력도 뛰어났죠

translation.en: [commentator] O'Neal with a gorgeous 360 spin on Vlade Divac. Wow!
translation.ko: 블라디 디박 상대로 멋진 360도 회전을 보여줍니다

translation.en: [Miller] Jermaine was on the verge of becoming a superstar in our game.
translation.ko: 저메인은 팀의 슈퍼스타로 거듭날 참이었어요 "인디애나 주축으로 성장한 오닐"

translation.en: And he was becoming the face of the Indiana Pacers.
translation.ko: 인디애나 페이서스의 간판이 되어가고 있었죠 "소년에서 남자로"

translation.en: [announcer] First-time NBA All-Star center Jermaine O'Neal.
translation.ko: NBA 올스타전에 데뷔한 센터 "페이서스 오닐 가장 많이 발전한 선수" 저메인 오닐입니다

translation.en: Then I'm like, "Okay, I like it."
I didn't care about minutes or points.
translation.ko: 몇 분 남았든, 몇 점 넣었든

translation.en: I wanted all these young guys to do the bulk of the work.
translation.ko: 그저 어린 선수들이 제 몫을 해주길 원했어요

translation.en: I wanted to win a championship for Indiana.
That's what it was all about for me.
My main focus,
and it doesn't always take place in one year,
translation.ko: 한 시즌 안에 이루어지지 못한다고 해도

translation.en: is get players that fit with each other.
[Artest] When I got traded to Indiana, I was on the bus going to the Miami game.
translation.ko: 인디애나로 트레이드됐을 때 마이애미 시합에 가고 있었는데

translation.en: They said, "Don't get off the bus."
Uh, "You're traded."
And I remember… You know, I never listen. So, I got off the bus.
translation.ko: 저야 원래 말을 안 들어서 버스에서 내렸어요

translation.en: And they said, "Don't get on the court."
And I went on the court.
And they said, "Get off the court."
I said, "No," and I practiced for an hour.
translation.ko: 전 싫다고 하고 한 시간 동안 연습했어요

translation.en: [newsman] In their first meeting with the Indianapolis media today,
the newest members of the Indiana Pacers
expressed relief over getting out of Chicago.
[Artest] It feels good to be here after a couple of years in Chicago losing,
translation.ko: 여기 오게 돼서 기쁩니다 2년간 시카고에서 패배했고

translation.en: and, uh, it just was hard, you know. I just wanna bring that winning effort.
translation.ko: 쉽지 않았거든요 여기서 우승을 거들고 싶어요

translation.en: I didn't have a lot of trust with people
just because of things that I was going through and stuff.
For me, it's enemies. Everybody's an enemy to me, all the time.
But once we step on the court, I trust that.
[Miller] I remember the very first practice after the trade.
That practice, which was three hours,
I remember Jermaine coming up to me and was like,
"I don't know if we've ever practiced this hard."
translation.ko: '이렇게 열심히 연습한 건 처음인 것 같아'

translation.en: And I'm like, "You're right. I think this is gonna be good."
[O'Neal] Ron was probably the hardest worker that I've ever seen in my life.
translation.ko: 론만큼 열심히 뛰는 선수를 평생 본 적이 없어요

translation.en: I think he was probably the most talented defensive player
that we saw in an entire decade.
Ron is different.
But different isn't bad.
Different is just sometimes unique.
And Ron was unique in his talents.
[Walsh] I'd never seen anybody play as hard as he did.
translation.ko: 그 친구만큼 최선을 다하는 선수를 못 봤어요

translation.en: He was a force out there.
When I step onto the court, I'm just 100% in.
Bring it to this. Bring it to this. Bring it to this.
Test me right here, it don't matter who. You could be the biggest gangster.
This is where we go. I'll die here.
[Miller] Every team needs a Ron Artest.
translation.ko: 론 아테스트 같은 선수는 팀에 필수적이에요

translation.en: You need a guy that everyone's a little bit afraid of.
translation.ko: 상대가 두려워하는 선수가 한 명쯤 있어야 하죠

translation.en: [commentator] Hammered out of bounds by Artest.
Now having words with Heat assistant coach Keith Askins.
translation.ko: 히트의 키스 애스킨스 코치와 말다툼을 하네요

translation.en: Wrong guy to pick with is Artest.
You know, that's, uh, that's who he is.
Hell of a player, but he's gotta get that under control.
He would say to me,
"Well, that's not fair. They shouldn't be able to do that."
I realized he's got an exaggerated idea of justice.
translation.ko: 과도한 정의감을 지녔다는 걸 그때 깨달았어요

translation.en: I just didn't like people. I always had a chip.
translation.ko: 전 사람을 싫어했어요 늘 화를 품고 살았죠

translation.en: At the time, we had the best interior defender in Jermaine,
translation.ko: 당시 최고의 골밑 수비수 저메인이 있었고

translation.en: and we had the best perimeter defender in Ron.
translation.ko: 또 최고의 외곽 수비수 론이 있었어요

translation.en: It was poetry in motion at times when they were on the court.
translation.ko: 그 둘이 같이 출동하면 한 편의 시와 같았죠

translation.en: After I shut you down, if you do beat me, then Jermaine will shut you down.
translation.ko: '날 뚫어봐, 날 뚫고 나면 저메인이 기다릴 거야'

translation.en: We were also loose cannons mentally. Yeah, me and Jermaine.
Jermaine's a loose cannon, but he kept it really tight.
translation.ko: 저메인도 그런 성격이지만 그걸 잘 다스렸죠

translation.en: [O'Neal] We had a lot of the same mentalities.
Dog, hard-nosed, we gonna go get you.
translation.ko: 거칠고, 물러나지 않고 한번 물면 안 놔줬죠

translation.en: And we just kinda started blazing through teams.
translation.ko: 그런데 만나는 팀마다 우릴 못 당하더라고요

translation.en: The Indiana Pacers, they are rolling.
The Indiana Pacers have the best record in the NBA.
translation.ko: 인디애나 페이서스는 NBA 최고 기록을 보유 중입니다

translation.en: [newsman] Indiana Pacers, best team in the league.
[newsman 2] Indiana Pacers, the team to beat in the East right now.
You guys don't understand how good we were.
[O'Neal] We had the best record in the league the whole year.
translation.ko: 그해 우리 팀 성적은 리그에서 최고였어요

translation.en: Made it to the Eastern Conference Finals.
I look back at it now, and that was the series that ignited…
everything.
Detroit had incredible talent,
and we knew it was gonna be a tough scenario.
[Miller] We were the two best teams, defensively and offensively.
translation.ko: 결승에서 만난 두 팀은 수비 능력도 공격 능력도 최고였어요

translation.en: So I knew whoever won this was gonna win a championship.
translation.ko: 여기서 이기는 팀이 챔피언이 될 게 당연했죠

translation.en: That series, they pushed us to the limit.
In playoff basketball,
the margin of error is this small.
Everyone has the physical capabilities. It's…
translation.ko: 신체적 능력은 모두 정상급이라 중요한 건 정신이죠

translation.en: [commentator 1] Whoa! Hamilton is fouled this time.
[commentator 2] Artest may be thrown out of the game, but it's definitely gonna be a flagrant.
[commentator 1] That's just not a good move.
[commentator 2] This is a huge play for them.
At this time in the game, you can't lose your cool.
translation.ko: 이 시점에서 평정심을 잃어서는 안 돼요

translation.en: It's just too crucial.
You can't foul at the wrong time
-and give your opponent an advantage. -[buzzer sounds]
[commentator] And for the first time in 14 years,
the Pistons go to the NBA Finals!
They're the 2004 Eastern Conference champions!
We lost game six in Detroit.
It's like somebody sticking a knife into you.
The flagrant foul
that took place with Ron Artest, was that the difference in this game?
translation.ko: 론 아테스트의 플래그런트파울이 있었죠 그 영향이 컸을까요?

translation.en: Well, it certainly had an impact.
You know, it was a tough call.
Yeah, I just put my forearm up, you know what I'm saying? And, um…
translation.ko: 전 그저 팔을 올리고 있었어요 그런데…

translation.en: I think, uh…
But the ref saw it. You know, he was, uh…
Losing to Detroit in the Conference, I remember.
translation.ko: 디트로이트 콘퍼런스 결승에서 패배한 거 기억나죠

translation.en: Yeah. We should've went to the finals. We should've definitely won.
When we lose that series, who wins the championship?
translation.ko: 그렇게 시리즈에서 졌는데 누가 챔피언이 됐을까요?

translation.en: [commentator] The Detroit Pistons have just shocked the Los Angeles Lakers.
They were mentally tougher than we were.
I'm like, "You guys!"
It was just frustrating.
[Artest] See you later. Love you.
Get out the garbage!
The next year, I knew something was wrong, like…
I knew something was definitely wrong and that I just needed to step back.
translation.ko: 분명 뭔가 잘못된 것 같아서 한 발짝 물러나고 싶어졌죠

translation.en: I said, "I want my retirement papers,"
and the Pacers said, "No, you gotta play." [chuckles]
"You're under contract six more years." [chuckles]
I felt like Ronnie was coming out with something like that every day.
translation.ko: 전 론이 항상 하는 돌발 행동이라고 생각했어요

translation.en: One day he'd say, "I can't come to practice tomorrow. I gotta do my music."
translation.ko: 한번은 음악 해야 한다면서 연습에 빠지겠다고 하더군요

translation.en: As a man, you gotta be able to do what you want.
So if I decide to wanna leave the game or take a month off, I'm a grown man.
translation.ko: 농구를 관두거나 한 달 쉬고 싶을 수도 있고 "론 아테스트 팀에 휴가 요청" 전 성인이잖아요

translation.en: It doesn't make me crazy, you know, to wanna do something I wanna do.
translation.ko: 하고 싶은 걸 한다고 해서 미친놈이 되는 건 아니죠

translation.en: If you're asking for time off at the beginning of the year…
I mean, dude, we got six and a half months left, and you're asking for a timeout now?
I still got my album coming out November 23rd,
and after the album comes out, I'm gonna, uh,
you know, make sure all my time is focused on winning the championship.
translation.ko: 앨범이 나온 다음에는 챔피언십 우승에만 전념할 생각입니다

translation.en: I had so much anxiety all the time.
You get that heart pumping.
It was something I couldn't control at that time. It was every day. Every day.
translation.ko: 제가 어찌할 수 없는 증상을 매일같이 겪었어요

translation.en: So, I was like, "I really do need to try to figure out what's wrong."
"Why are you not happy around basketball and your teammates?"
"Why are you not happy? Figure it out, figure it out."
I was already in therapy, but you don't get better overnight.
translation.ko: 정신과 치료도 받았지만 하루아침에 해결될 문제는 아니죠

translation.en: You know, we knew he had a psychiatrist that… that traveled everywhere we went.
translation.ko: 항상 정신과 의사랑 다니는 건 우리도 알았어요

translation.en: We knew he had sessions that he had to have with her. We knew that much,
but we were never, ever, you know, told that he had a certain issue,
translation.ko: 론에게 문제가 있다는 사실은 한 번도 들어본 적 없었어요 병이 있다는 사실을요

translation.en: medical issue.
translation.ko: 한 번도 들어본 적 없었어요 병이 있다는 사실을요

translation.en: I had depression and anxiety.
I would be depressed about certain things and have anxiety about future things.
Some people have control over their emotions. I don't.
translation.ko: 전 제가 느끼는 감정을 통제할 수가 없어요

translation.en: If really I'm excited, happy, I've just dunked on somebody, game-winner,
that emotional level is not a good place for me.
translation.ko: 감정이 격해지는 건 좋은 일이 아니에요

translation.en: Positively or negatively, you have no control of that.
translation.ko: 긍정적이든, 부정적이든 제가 통제할 수 없죠

translation.en: Come on! The fuck you all doing?
I'm not gonna do this with you! Come on, my nigga!
Get your motherfucking security right!
translation.ko: 경비 일 하나 제대로 못 해?

translation.en: [man] We got a fight back here.
[man 2] You gotta chill.
At times, Ron could be a little edgy.
And the dynamic between Jermaine and Ron was unsettling.
translation.ko: 저메인과 론의 관계도 팀원들을 불안하게 만들었죠

translation.en: I think the final straw for us
was when he said he had a death in his family
and went to the Source Awards.
[announcer] Ladies and gentlemen, please welcome the Tru Warier
translation.ko: 모두 환영해 주세요! 진정한 전사 론 아테스트와 피티 파블로입니다!

translation.en: Ron Artest and Petey Pablo!
translation.ko: 진정한 전사 론 아테스트와 피티 파블로입니다!

translation.en: You were saying you were going away for a funeral, then three or four days later,
we turn the TV on and you're presenting an award at an award show,
translation.ko: TV를 켜니까 시상식에서 수상자를 발표하고 있더라고요

translation.en: and we ain't seen you in three or four days.
And the winner is…
I don't know what I'm doing up here. It's all good though.
translation.ko: 뭘 하러 나온 건지 모르겠지만 괜찮아요

translation.en: I felt I was trying to escape.
I was trying to find any way to escape. Definitely.
translation.ko: 어떤 식으로든 탈출구를 찾으려고 했죠 그랬어요

translation.en: I'm not gonna answer any more questions about Ron.
translation.ko: 론에 대한 질문은 더 이상 안 받을게요

translation.en: Ron doesn't wanna be here. Ron doesn't matter anymore.
translation.ko: 론은 마음이 떠났어요 중요한 팀원이 아니에요

translation.en: It's about the Pacers, the players that suit up every single day.
translation.ko: 열심히 뛰는 팀원들과 팀에 대해 얘기하는 자리에서

translation.en: I'm tired of answering questions about Ron.
translation.ko: 매번 론에 대해 답변하는 것도 지긋지긋합니다

translation.en: I'm pleading with these guys.
"Get on the same page!"
I could not get them to understand the opportunity.
translation.ko: 우승할 기회라는 걸 이해시킬 수 없었어요

translation.en: [Artest] I never listened to Reggie.
So any time he's, like, giving me leadership and mentorship,
translation.ko: 제 앞에서 리더 노릇 하거나 멘토처럼 굴 때도

translation.en: I'm thinking, "Bust his ass in practice."
I know that we're putting together
young guys who could rub each other wrong,
translation.ko: 서로 마찰할 수도 있는 젊은이들이란 건 알았어요

translation.en: but, you know, I really wanted to win,
and I was looking for one final piece of the team.
translation.ko: 전 팀의 마지막 퍼즐 조각을 찾고 있었어요

translation.en: And that's why I made the trade for Stephen.
[Jackson] I remember getting that call from Donnie Walsh and Larry Bird.
translation.ko: 도니 월시와 래리 버드에게 전화가 왔어요

translation.en: I had to put 'em on speakerphone 'cause I'm on the block.
I'm on 3200 with all my homeboys.
"Welcome to the Indiana Pacers," duh-duh-duh.
You know, it was a great moment.
When he said, "Welcome to…" all my homeboys get to running. Just, "Oh!"
translation.ko: 그 말을 듣자마자 친구들은 난리가 났고요

translation.en: And I knew the opportunity was… was priceless.
[Miller] When Stephen came,
it was the best thing for us, because now we got Jermaine, Ron,
translation.ko: 더 바랄 게 없었어요 이미 저메인과 론이 있는 팀에

translation.en: and now you're bringing in another tough, somewhat crazy dude in Stephen Jackson.
translation.ko: 좀 별나지만 실력 알아주는 스티븐 잭슨까지 합류한 거잖아요

translation.en: Everything has to come through Indiana. There's no secret.
translation.ko: 모든 팀은 인디애나를 거쳐야 해요 그건 확실합니다

translation.en: They gotta come through us to get to where they wanna be.
And I-I-I think we're the team to beat.
We have all the pieces. We gotta put 'em together.
translation.ko: 모든 말이 모였으니까 호흡만 맞추면 됩니다

translation.en: [reporter] A challenge you relish.
Yeah. I'm ready for a challenge. That's what I live for.
translation.ko: 네, 준비됐어요 전 도전을 위해 살거든요

translation.en: -I make love to pressure. -[laughs] That's what I do.
Me and him was, like, we both kinda street.
So we're arguing about who's gonna guard the best guy,
translation.ko: 그래서 더 잘하는 선수를 서로 수비하겠다고

translation.en: like, almost come to blows.
Then I'm like, "All right, Steve, you got it."
So I'm like, "This guy is crazy!" [laughs]
We got a lot of similarities, but we're totally different.
translation.ko: 우린 비슷한 점도 많지만 완전히 달라요

translation.en: I knew he was a little off. You know what I mean?
But he was a hell of a basketball player.
And that's all… I didn't judge nothing else but that.
translation.ko: 전 그거 말곤 보이지도 않았고 신경도 안 썼어요

translation.en: I didn't care. I was weird. I did my own thing. I smoked weed all day.
translation.ko: 전 그거 말곤 보이지도 않았고 신경도 안 썼어요 저도 별났거든요 대마초를 매일매일 피웠다고요

translation.en: Guys like me and Ron, we look at basketball as our life.
translation.ko: 저나 론 같은 사람은 농구가 인생이에요

translation.en: This is all we can do. God gave me this gift to help my family, to get out of the situation I was in.
translation.ko: 제 가족이 잘살 수 있도록 신이 제게 주신 축복이죠

translation.en: [O'Neal] Jack is a very aggressive person. We have a lot of similar traits.
translation.ko: 스티븐은 매우 공격적이에요 저와 닮은 구석이 많죠

translation.en: He would turn that volume up very quickly and tell you about it.
translation.ko: 공격성이 필요할 때 빠르게 발휘할 줄도 알았어요

translation.en: He's down for the cause.
I'm a loyal guy. Like, one thing about it. If I'm with you, I'm with you, you know.
translation.ko: 전 의리 있는 사람이에요 한번 친구면 영원한 친구죠

translation.en: We shoot this, and we go to a bar afterwards, somebody say something,
translation.ko: 이거 촬영하고 바에 갔는데 누가 당신한테 시비 걸면

translation.en: I'll be the first one to stand up. That's how I am.
translation.ko: 제가 가장 먼저 나설 거예요 성격이 그래요

translation.en: If I'm with you, I'm with you. I was the missing piece.
translation.ko: 한번 함께면 영원히 함께예요 제가 마지막 조각이었죠

translation.en: That's basically what they were saying.
I was the missing piece to the championship team.
[Miller] There's only a handful of teams that can say,
translation.ko: 이런 말을 할 수 있는 팀은 몇 개 없잖아요

translation.en: "We have a shot to win the championship." Out of my 18 years,
translation.ko: '우린 우승할 수 있다' 제 18년 경력 중에

translation.en: that season, we were loaded for bear.
This was our year.
[commentator] This is the Showdown of the East we've been waiting for.
A rivalry that's been brewing long before this season ever started.
Two teams, similar styles, only one survivor.
translation.ko: "인디애나 대 디트로이트" 비슷한 스타일의 두 팀 중 한 팀만 살아남습니다

translation.en: [Artest] Going into the Palace, we was already seven and two.
I knew that was the game I wanted more than any game.
But I didn't know what was gonna actually happen.
translation.ko: 하지만 무슨 일이 생길지 모르고 있었어요

translation.en: We were coming in there to make a statement.
"Yeah, y'all got the chip, but we're letting y'all know
y'all gonna be seeing us this year."
-Where we from? -[all] Detroit!
-Where we from? -[all] Detroit!
Detroit was one of the hardest places to play.
They don't make it easy for you.
Obviously, um, you know, we're facing a tough challenge
translation.ko: 다들 아시다시피 팰리스에서 경기를 치르는 건

translation.en: going into a… uh, going into the Palace.
They have a rabid fan base.
Very faithful and admiring fans.
Um, and very boisterous at times.
Yeah! Number one, baby! Number one! Yeah! That's what I'm talking about!
The fans were a huge part of a lot of the success,
translation.ko: 팬들은 팀의 성공에 크게 기여했어요 "버디 프랜츠 피스턴스 팬"

translation.en: because even though you're on the court, you can hear those fans going crazy.
translation.ko: 코트 위에서도 팬들의 미쳐 날뛰는 소리가 들리거든요

translation.en: When we would come into the gym, we knew the Pistons were gonna win.
translation.ko: 경기장에 들어가기 전부터 우린 피스턴스가 이길 걸 알았어요

translation.en: We just didn't know by how much.
Any time you put 20,000 people together for four or five hours,
translation.ko: 2만 명에 달하는 관중이 4~5시간 동안 모여 술도 마시죠

translation.en: and they're drinking,
the stage is set. Somewhere, somebody's gonna have an issue.
translation.ko: 그런 상황에서는 문제가 터질 수밖에 없어요

translation.en: There was a couple of guys that we were gonna remove their season tickets.
translation.ko: 그날도 두 명의 시즌 티켓을 박탈하려고 했어요

translation.en: We kinda had enough of their, uh, shenanigans.
It was a Friday night. We didn't have to work Saturday,
translation.ko: "2004 월드 챔피언" 금요일 밤이었고 토요일은 쉬는 날이라서

translation.en: so it was kinda like, you know, you kind of enjoyed it more.
translation.ko: "찰리 해대드 피스턴스 팬" 좀 더 즐기고 싶었어요

translation.en: Have a few drinks, hang out with friends. Kinda like treating myself.
translation.ko: 같이 술도 마시고 친구들과 놀면서 스트레스를 푸는 거죠

translation.en: Charlie's a fan. Uh, he was a season ticket holder.
translation.ko: 찰리는 피스턴스 팬이고 시즌 티켓 보유자였어요

translation.en: And he had issues that night. And so, we were…
going to address it with him that we were taking away his season tickets that night.
translation.ko: 시즌 티켓을 박탈할 거라고 얘기할 참이었죠

translation.en: We would normally probably work the Pistons games
translation.ko: 한 달에 두세 번은 피스턴스 경기장에 나갔는데

translation.en: two, three times a month.
On that day, we were assigned on the east side.
I think we had some rivalry with Indiana, I think, as well,
translation.ko: 인디애나와의 라이벌 의식도 크게 작용했던 것 같아요

translation.en: and the crowds were pretty charged up.
Everybody in the NBA wants one of these.
This is what they play for, a championship ring.
[Gray] I was there to broadcast the game for ESPN.
Indiana was a terrific team.
They were championship contenders
and may have, at that time, been the best team in the NBA.
translation.ko: "짐 그레이 스포츠캐스터" NBA 최고의 팀이라 해도 과언은 아니었어요

translation.en: But Detroit was a good team.
They were a really good team.
[Miller] I had broke my finger, so I was in a cast. Stephen was moved to the shooting guard.
translation.ko: 전 손가락에 깁스를 하는 바람에 스티븐이 슈팅가드를 맡았죠

translation.en: I didn't know the magnitude of the rivalry that I was walking into.
translation.ko: 전 두 팀의 라이벌 관계가 얼마나 살벌한지 몰랐어요

translation.en: You gotta thing, they was wrestling with this team all last year
translation.ko: 작년 동부 콘퍼런스 결승에서 피 튀기며 싸웠던 두 팀이

translation.en: in the Eastern Conference Finals, about to go to blows.
translation.ko: 작년 동부 콘퍼런스 결승에서 피 튀기며 싸웠던 두 팀이 다시 만난 거였죠

translation.en: It was absolutely a statement game for us.
This is our moment, and let's leave no doubt.
translation.ko: 고대하던 순간이니까 아쉬움 남기고 싶지 않았죠

translation.en: [Wallace] They felt that was their year,
and we felt like we had to defend our title.
I remember that night. The Palace was electrifying.
Man, it was…
It was almost like having an out-of-body experience.
translation.ko: 유체 이탈이라도 한 것만 같은 분위기였죠

translation.en: You could feel the hair stand up on the back of your neck.
[Donaghy] Whenever you go into a nationally televised game,
there's a different roar in the arena.
translation.ko: 경기장 분위기가 달라요 조명도, 카메라도 더 많고요

translation.en: There's more lights. There's more cameras.
translation.ko: 경기장 분위기가 달라요 조명도, 카메라도 더 많고요 "팀 도너기 NBA 심판"

translation.en: You know, they're real careful who gets assigned games like that
because they want not to be embarrassed as a league.
Nobody liked refereeing the Pistons back then.
You knew you were in for a rough night.
When you have Ben Wallace, Stephen Jackson, Ron Artest,
translation.ko: 벤 월리스, 스티븐 잭슨 론 아테스트가 나온다면

translation.en: I mean, that's just a recipe for disaster right there.
Basketball fans from around the great state of Michigan,
translation.ko: 위대한 미시간주 각지의 농구 팬 여러분!

translation.en: and those of you here at the Palace from across the world,
stay on your feet.
-["The Final Countdown" playing] -Time to meet and greet the ballers
representing the D… troit Pistons!
[O'Neal] They had the most dynamic announcer. Right?
And it gasses you, where you saying, "Look, I'm at your ass today, Detroit."
translation.ko: 기분이 더러워서 이를 갈았죠 '두고 봐라, 디트로이트'

translation.en: [announcer] At 6'9", the center, wearing the big red three,
B-B-B-B-B-B-B-B-B-Ben [trills lips] Wallace!
I remember they did the Ben Wallace introduction. That got me hyped.
translation.ko: 벤 월리스 소개하는 걸 보고 제대로 흥분했어요 '꺼져, 우리가 혼쭐을 내주마'

translation.en: That got me hyped. Like, "Let's bust they ass. Fuck that."
At the time, I didn't know Ben Wallace lost his brother.
translation.ko: 그땐 벤 월리스가 형제를 잃었다는 걸 몰랐어요

translation.en: Having that energy, you know, it was…
I knew I couldn't put that energy nowhere else but into basketball.
translation.ko: 그 슬픔을 농구 말고는 풀 곳이 없더군요

translation.en: It was like a powder keg.
[commentator 1] A fun matchup to watch during the regular season.
translation.ko: 정규 시즌 때 봐도 참 재밌는 조합이죠

translation.en: We can only hope they'll meet again in the playoffs.
Pistons so far perfect at home. Another packed house at the Palace.
translation.ko: 피스턴스는 홈에서 패한 적이 없죠 팰리스는 이번에도 꽉 찼습니다

translation.en: Going into that game, I thought we could beat Detroit,
translation.ko: 그 시합을 앞두고 디트로이트를 이길 거라고 생각했어요

translation.en: and I wanted to see if this type of team would work.
translation.ko: 제가 꾸린 팀이 실력을 발휘할지 궁금했죠

translation.en: [commentator 2] O'Neal.
[commentator 1] Artest steps back… Oh, what a quarter for Ron Artest.
translation.ko: 아테스트, 한 발 뒤에서 슛 놀라운 쿼터 성적입니다

translation.en: Even though at that time I was struggling, I was playing great.
The game was a beatdown. We dominated from beginning to end.
translation.ko: 시합은 일방적이었어요 처음부터 우리가 갖고 놀았죠

translation.en: -Ron dominated. Nobody couldn't stop him. -[whistle blows]
Two, three, four guards couldn't guard Ron at the time.
translation.ko: 네 명이 달라붙어도 론을 막을 순 없었어요

translation.en: He was too agile. He was definitely the best player on the court.
translation.ko: 아주 민첩했고, 누가 봐도 그중에서 가장 뛰어난 선수였죠

translation.en: We were up double digits, and my young boys were jawing.
translation.ko: 10점 넘게 앞서 나갔어요 팀원들은 서로 소통하고

translation.en: They were clicking.
Ron and Jermaine.
It's good Ron, and it's good Jermaine.
It was fantastic.
This is our moment. It's our coming-out party.
translation.ko: 우리를 위한 자리였어요 신고식을 치르는 중이었죠

translation.en: We came in with a different type of swag.
Stephen's like… he's so clutch.
I'm like, "Wow, this guy makes every big shot."
We knew right away we was the best team.
translation.ko: 우리 팀이 최고라는 걸 바로 직감했어요

translation.en: We were kicking their ass.
They put a championship team together. It was obvious.
translation.ko: 챔피언십 우승은 우리 거였어요 누가 봐도요

translation.en: 'Cause we were beating them down,
the normal ticket holders were gone.
They had left.
So it was the people that were trickling their way down
translation.ko: 그러자 뒤쪽에 있던 사람들이 내려오기 시작했는데

translation.en: that were probably already liquored up, coming on down to fill those seats.
Oh, man, very disrespectful, like, the way they did it.
translation.ko: 정말 무례한 짓을 했어요 시합은 끝난 셈이었는데

translation.en: The game was almost over. They had starters out there playing.
translation.ko: 정말 무례한 짓을 했어요 시합은 끝난 셈이었는데 여전히 선발들을 내보냈죠

translation.en: They were up by 15, 20 points.
[commentator] Oh! Wallace with a terrific block!
That's not a foul.
At the end of the game, we're up by 15. In my mind, the game's over.
Jamaal Tinsley tells Ron,
"You can get your foul now." Ron looked at him like, "Huh?"
translation.ko: '이제 파울 막 해도 돼' 론이 쳐다봤어요 '이제 파울해도 된다고'

translation.en: "You can get your foul now."
You got your foul. You can go now, right? All right?
translation.ko: 이제 파울 막 해도 돼, 알았지?

translation.en: Why are you even telling him that?
Ron doesn't need a battery in his back to do something crazy.
translation.ko: 왜 론에게 미친 짓을 하라고 배터리를 달아주냐고요

translation.en: [commentator] Artest with 24, O'Neal at 20,
Croshere 15, Tinsley 13.
[Jackson] As we're running back, I guard Ben.
translation.ko: 저는 벤을 맡고 있었는데 벤에게 공이 왔고

translation.en: When they throw him the ball, I'm not gonna try to play defense on him.
translation.ko: 저는 벤을 맡고 있었는데 벤에게 공이 왔고 전 막을 생각조차 없었어요 반칙할 생각은 더욱더 없고요

translation.en: I'm not even gonna try to foul him.
translation.ko: 전 막을 생각조차 없었어요 반칙할 생각은 더욱더 없고요

translation.en: -[Artest] He was going for a layup. -[commentator] Oh!
I didn't want him to get the layup, so I pushed him.
It was too hard of a foul at that point in time during the game.
translation.ko: 다 끝난 경기인 것치고 너무 과격한 파울이었어요

translation.en: [commentator] Oh, Wallace! Right at Artest!
This has potential to be serious if they don't get between them.
translation.ko: 말리지 않으면 상황이 심각해질 것 같은데요

translation.en: Wallace upset. Players trying to hold each other off.
Stephen Jackson, and we see Wallace trying to be peacemaker.
translation.ko: 스티븐 잭슨과 라시드 월리스가 중재하려는 것 같은데요

translation.en: Now Jackson yelling…
[Miller] The dust-up I have no problem with.
That happens all the time. The pushing, the shoving…
You know, that's all fake.
Most of the time, nobody in the NBA wanna fight.
It has to be real disrespectful shit for somebody to throw punches.
translation.ko: 주먹이 나갔다는 건 정말 무례한 짓을 한 거죠

translation.en: Where it all turned
is when Ron went and laid on the scorer's table.
Went over and laid down, which is not normal.
translation.ko: 그냥 위에 눕더라고요 평범한 행동은 아니죠

translation.en: It's not normal to lay down on the scorer's table.
translation.ko: 기록석 위에 눕는 게 평범한 행동은 아니잖아요?

translation.en: That's crazy, too, you know?
That's… That's… That's almost worse than the foul.
[Artest] I was already in therapy. So I was practicing in real time.
translation.ko: 전 정신 상담에서 배운 걸 실천하고 있었어요

translation.en: One thing was take five, right?
So if something happens, you're like, "One, two, three…"
translation.ko: 무슨 일이 생기면 세는 거죠 '하나, 둘, 셋'

translation.en: Before you do anything, just count, 'cause then you get more time to think.
translation.ko: 행동하기 전에 5초를 세면서 생각할 시간을 가지는 거예요

translation.en: [Artest] My team was all around me.
It was funny 'cause I felt like I was a big dog, like…
translation.ko: 제가 중요한 사람이 된 것 같아서 웃기더군요

translation.en: I did feel like my team got… I know my team,
translation.ko: 팀원들이 지켜주니까… 전 팀원들을 잘 알아서

translation.en: so I know, like, Jermaine's not gonna just let Ben come over and touch me.
translation.ko: 벤이 와서 절 건드리지 못하게 저메인이 막아줄 걸 알았어요

translation.en: I know that for a fact. Like, I got Steve Jackson.
I'm like, "All right, Cool. I don't need to do nothing. I'm fine."
[commentator] Wallace is still charged up.
Now, Wallace, I would assume, has been ejected.
Ben wore, like, 10,000 armbands and headbands and wrist bands,
translation.ko: 벤은 팔, 머리, 손목을 밴드로 감싸고 있었는데

translation.en: and he started throwing things.
[Donaghy] Saw him throwing the headband and the wristbands.
He definitely was losing his temper.
The fans don't know the majority of us are actually friends,
translation.ko: 팬들은 선수들 대부분이 친구 사이라는 걸 몰라요

translation.en: so they think that this is a real street brawl scenario.
So however you react, they're gonna react.
If you do this, what do you think they gonna do?
If you do this, what do you think they gonna do?
The crowd feeds off the players.
Out of the corner of my eye,
I see it coming.
Super slo-mo. Like, it just…
It just… Everybody was supposed to see it. That's how slow it went.
[Miller] Bam!
[commentator] Now Artest has jumped over the scorer's table
and is trying to get down to the bench!
Artest is in the stands!
Oh, this is awful. Fans are getting involved.
Once I saw him go, I went.
He needed aid.
As I get to him, another beer is thrown in his face. And that's the guy I…
translation.ko: 그런데 다른 놈도 맥주를 뿌리길래 그 자식을…

translation.en: [commentator] Stephen Jackson's in the fans.
The security trying to somehow restore order.
Fans and players are going at it! The players trying to help each other out!
translation.ko: 관중과 선수들이 싸우고 선수들끼리 도와주고 있습니다

translation.en: Rasheed Wallace going into the stands!
[commentator] This is a disgrace.
All the players, they're jumping in there to try and get the other players out
translation.ko: 선수들이 관중석에 뛰어들어 동료들을 끌어내고 있습니다

translation.en: because the fans have become involved.
[commentator] Oh, what a sad scene here at the Palace.
[Artest] Walking down the stands, I'm thinking, "It's good."
I didn't think anything else was gonna happen at all.
I thought it was gonna be over.
[O'Neal] I just stopped and paused, and I just started looking.
"Where is the security at?"
There was no police. I didn't see a policeman in the building.
translation.ko: 건물 안에 경찰관이 한 명도 안 보였어요

translation.en: I didn't see any security. There was nobody there to stop this.
translation.ko: 경비도 마찬가지고 상황을 정리할 사람이 없었죠

translation.en: Everybody was everywhere. I mean, it was just like a melee.
And then, they were pushing us towards the exit.
Somehow, I got on the court.
I remember being shocked, like I'd seen an alien, like…
translation.ko: 많이 놀랐어요 외계인을 본 것 같았죠

translation.en: "This guy, uh, coming to the court to fight?"
translation.ko: '이 자식이 나랑 싸우려고 코트에 나온 건가?'

translation.en: 'Cause at that point, I'm fed up.
translation.ko: 그땐 질린 상태였거든요 꾹 참고 있었는데

translation.en: I'm trying not to fight, but these guys are giving me a reason…
translation.ko: 그땐 질린 상태였거든요 꾹 참고 있었는데 싸울 이유를 준 셈이니까 저는 오히려 마음이 편했죠

translation.en: This is my comfort zone.
translation.ko: 싸울 이유를 준 셈이니까 저는 오히려 마음이 편했죠

translation.en: You wouldn't in your right mind walk down on the court and think it's a good idea
translation.ko: 제정신인 사람이라면 관중석에 난입했던 론 아테스트랑 싸우겠다고 코트에 나오진 않을 겁니다

translation.en: to take on Ron Artest after he's been in the stands.
translation.ko: 론 아테스트랑 싸우겠다고 코트에 나오진 않을 겁니다

translation.en: [commentator] Oh, what a sad scene here at the Palace.
[commentator] Now another fight's breaking out in front of the Pistons bench.
translation.ko: 피스턴스 벤치 앞에서 다른 싸움이 벌어지고 있어요

translation.en: It's a fan. This is very, very dangerous.
Fans are throwing…
I didn't see him coming at all. Sucker punched me.
translation.ko: 예상 못 했어요 기습 공격을 당했죠

translation.en: You know, quite a…
bitch move, tell you the truth.
I just all-out sprint over there to try to help him.
[Miller] He slipped. Thank God.
It was the best miss of Jermaine's career.
translation.ko: 그 펀치가 빗나간 게 저메인에겐 천만다행이었어요

translation.en: 'Cause if Jemaine would've connected on that punch…
…that fan would have been dead.
[commentator] …now onto the court.
Ron Artest has a look in his eye that's very scary right now.
translation.ko: 론 아테스트가 겁에 질린 눈을 하고 있어요

translation.en: The scariest moment was once I realized how out of control this got
translation.ko: 통제가 안 된다는 걸 안 순간 오싹한 기분이 들더군요

translation.en: and how much further it's gonna go.
At the time, we had three officers on the court.
translation.ko: 그땐 경기장에 경관이 세 명 있었어요

translation.en: Not the best odds against 20,000 people.
It was out of control.
That's why the decision was we need to get the players off the court.
translation.ko: 그래서 일단 선수들을 코트에서 대피시켜야겠다고 생각했어요

translation.en: If we get them off the court, the fans will calm down.
translation.ko: 코트에서 안 보이면 관객들이 진정할 테니까요

translation.en: [Miller] An officer runs up from behind me,
and he has his mace thing out,
and he's getting ready to mace Ron.
I had no intention of spraying Ron Artest. He was already down on the floor.
translation.ko: 아테스트에게 뿌릴 생각 없었어요 이미 진정된 상태였고

translation.en: He had… He looked wore out.
At some point, I ran across Reggie Miller in a suit.
translation.ko: 그러다 정장 입은 레지 밀러를 맞닥뜨렸는데

translation.en: And I… At the time, I didn't know he was Reggie Miller or a player
translation.ko: 정장을 입었길래 그 사람이 레지 밀러인지

translation.en: 'cause he was in a suit. I'm asking him what is he doing.
translation.ko: 선수인지 모르겠어서 뭐 하는 사람이냐고 물었어요

translation.en: How you not know Reggie Miller's on the Indiana Pacers?
translation.ko: 인디애나 페이서스의 레지 밀러를 모르는 게 말이 돼요?

translation.en: [Miller] I grabbed the officer. Like, "What are you doing?"
I was like, "Go get all these people off the court. Don't be macing him."
translation.ko: '여기서 사람들을 내보내야지 왜 론한테 스프레이를 뿌려요?'

translation.en: That's when I really got pissed off.
Like, y'all are not trying to help us. It's really 15 against 30,000.
[commentator] They're trying to get the Pacers to go back to the locker room.
translation.ko: 페이서스 선수들을 라커 룸으로 이동시키려 하는군요

translation.en: [Miller] We all grab Ron, and we start to run.
[O'Neal] You see everybody merge to one area.
And they throwing everything they can get their hands on.
translation.ko: 그리고 손에 든 걸 무작정 던지기 시작했어요

translation.en: [commentator] Now these ridiculous fans trying to go at the players and throwing…
translation.ko: 관중은 터무니없게도 선수들에게 물건을 던지고 있습니다

translation.en: [commentator] Somebody could really get hurt.
[commentator] This is a bad showing from the Pistons fans.
Just firing bottles from the stairs.
All right, I'm good.
-I can walk! I can walk! -Okay!
We ride together, fam!
I remember saying to the camera, "We ride together."
We gonna always ride together. That was my attitude.
translation.ko: 우린 항상 한 팀이라는 게 제 마음가짐이었죠

translation.en: I was happy that I helped my brother down.
translation.ko: 제 형제를 도울 수 있어서 뿌듯했어요

translation.en: I was happy I was able to come to my brother's aid.
translation.ko: 도움이 필요한 형제의 곁을 지켜서 뿌듯했죠

translation.en: You can see that in my face in the locker room.
translation.ko: 라커 룸 들어가는 제 표정 보시면 알걸요?

translation.en: I was happy with what we did. I was there for my brother. Yes!
-[reporter] Tell me your name, sir. -Charlie Haddad.
He hit me in the face. I'm still hurt. I need X-rays on my whole face.
translation.ko: 얼굴을 맞아서 아직도 아파요 엑스레이 찍어야 될 것 같아요

translation.en: I don't even know what's going on.
You gotta stop, you gotta stop.
[man] Take it outside. You can't be in here.
After I get hit, we left and went through a different room,
translation.ko: 제가 맞고 나서 우리를 다른 방으로 데려갔어요

translation.en: like they were protecting me.
They started bringing people into my office.
A couple of them were like, "This would be funny
if one of us, you know, hurt ourselves and we can sue."
I remember looking. I see people rocking chairs, trying to get the chairs loose.
translation.ko: 경기장을 둘러보는데 사람들이 의자를 떼어내려고 마구 흔들고 있었어요

translation.en: The arena closed in on us very quick.
The crowd was getting a little bit, um, out of control.
translation.ko: 관중을 통제할 수 있는 상황이 아니었어요

translation.en: Somebody easily could grab your weapon.
[O'Neal] Then, all of a sudden, I saw the chair up in the air.
translation.ko: 그러다 결국 누가 의자를 던지는 걸 봤어요

translation.en: People were trying to hurt me and others.
It was just a horrible, horrible scene.
[Miller] We get to the locker room, and slowly but surely,
everyone was starting to filter in with their own stories.
translation.ko: 모두 자기 버전의 이야기를 늘어놓기 시작하더군요

translation.en: The whole time, I'm like, "Jermaine is gonna kick my butt."
The whole time.
I didn't wanna see him.
I knew he was gonna be pissed. It's all about winning for Jermaine.
translation.ko: 저메인의 목표는 오직 우승이라서 열받을 걸 알고 있었거든요

translation.en: Ron, uh, leans over to me and asks me, "Are we gonna get in trouble?"
translation.ko: 론이 저한테 와서 물어봤어요 '우리 별일 없겠지?'

translation.en: Said, "What you mean?"
I just lost it.
He charged Ron, and we end up breaking it up.
translation.ko: 저메인이 론을 덮치는 바람에 둘을 말려야 했죠

translation.en: I just needed confirmation that it was kinda, like, over.
translation.ko: 전 그 상황이 끝났다는 확신을 느끼고 싶었어요

translation.en: Yeah.
Then the police comes in and trying to grab me to take me to jail.
translation.ko: 그런데 경찰이 들어와서 저를 체포하려고 하더군요

translation.en: And I'm still… Again, I'm on survival mode.
I'm like, "Look, I'm not going with you."
"I am getting on this bus and getting on that plane,
and I'm going home." "Reach out to my lawyers."
The NBA and some of its fans achieved a new level of outrageousness last night.
translation.ko: 어젯밤 NBA와 몇몇 관객들이 도 넘은 광기를 보여주었습니다

translation.en: A fight broke out between the Pacer team and the fans in the stands.
translation.ko: 페이서스 선수들과 관객 사이에 몸싸움이 벌어졌는데요

translation.en: …disgraceful brawl at the Pacers-Pistons game in Detroit
may be the ugliest act of pure hooliganism in US sports history.
translation.ko: 미국 스포츠 역사상 가장 흉한 폭력 사례로 남을 것 같습니다

translation.en: Everybody talked about it. Every show talked about it. ESPN played it every five minutes.
translation.ko: 모든 쇼에서 그 얘기를 다뤘어요 ESPN에는 5분에 한 번씩 나왔죠

translation.en: It wasn't a brawl in Detroit Friday night. It was a full-scale riot
translation.ko: 금요일 밤은 단순한 싸움이 아니라 대규모 폭동이었습니다

translation.en: and one of the ugliest incidents of player-fan violence
translation.ko: 선수와 관객 사이에 일어난 폭력 사태 중

translation.en: we've ever seen in this country.
The players, paid gazillions of dollars here,
these are guys who have never had to follow the rules.
translation.ko: 규칙을 준수하는 모습을 전혀 보이지 않습니다

translation.en: They violated the number-one rule for any professional athlete,
translation.ko: 프로 운동선수가 지켜야 할 제1의 법칙을 위반했습니다

translation.en: and that is no matter what is said, no matter what is thrown at you,
translation.ko: 나를 향해 무슨 욕을 하든 무슨 물건을 던지든

translation.en: you don't go into the stands.
The narrative had changed.
It was all about us, the players.
Ron, Steve, JO, it's their fault. They were being thugs, acting out of line.

The visual of NBA players going into the stands and fighting

Pressure on the NBA to clean up its ranks,

Indiana's Jermaine O'Neal has been suspended for 25 games.
The NBA has handed out unprecedented punishments

One-nothing.

translation.en: for coldcocking Ron Artest.
translation.ko: 론 아테스트를 가격한 죄로 폭행 1건을 받았습니다

translation.en: [O'Neal] It's important for people to understand after the criminal part,
translation.ko: 사람들이 알아야 하는 게 있어요 전 형사 소송을 마친 뒤

translation.en: I went through a process to appeal my suspension.
translation.ko: 출전 정지 처분에 대한 항소 절차를 밟았는데

translation.en: And once it finally got to federal court,
a federal judge, who then saw every camera angle,
translation.ko: 연방 판사는 동영상을 모든 각도에서 확인한 결과

translation.en: said I had the right to do what I did.
translation.ko: 제게 그렇게 행동할 권리가 있었다고 판단했어요

translation.en: I'mma be honest with you. I didn't go up there with no story.
translation.ko: 솔직히 말할게요 전 변론 따위 없었어요

translation.en: I didn't give a fuck.
I was put in a situation where I either help my brother or not help him.
translation.ko: 그날 내 선택지는 형제를 돕느냐 마느냐였고 전 돕는 쪽을 택한 거죠

translation.en: I chose to help him.
translation.ko: 형제를 돕느냐 마느냐였고 전 돕는 쪽을 택한 거죠

translation.en: I apologized for going in the stands. I apologized for embarrassing the league.
translation.ko: 관중석에 난입한 거 사과했고 NBA에 먹칠한 거 사과했어요

translation.en: That's why I left it. I wasn't going in there kissing no ass.
translation.ko: 그게 전부예요 굽신거릴 생각은 추호도 없었죠

translation.en: They didn't decrease mine. They decreased JO's.
translation.ko: 제 징계는 유지됐고 저메인 징계는 완화됐어요

translation.en: And, uh, Ron had his full-year suspension as well.
translation.ko: 론의 잔여 경기 출전 정지도 그대로 유지됐죠

translation.en: It was… [sighs] a significant amount of time for what it was.
translation.ko: 일반적인 사건에 비해 너무 많은 시간이 소요됐어요

translation.en: They were misdemeanor assault and batteries.
Normally, you'd spend less than an hour on that case, start to finish.
translation.ko: 보통은 시작부터 끝까지 한 시간도 안 걸리는 일이죠

translation.en: What the criminal justice system did to them
paled in comparison to what the NBA did to 'em.
That cup of beer changed everything.
translation.ko: 맥주 한 컵으로 모든 게 변했어요

translation.en: Cost all of us…
a lot of money and time.
You know, it cost a lot of people a lot of things.
[commentator] Reggie Miller with universal respect.
translation.ko: "5개월 후" 레지 밀러는 모두의 존경을 받는 선수죠

translation.en: And the way he played this year, there was talk about would he reconsider.
translation.ko: 올해의 활약을 보고 은퇴를 재고할 거란 말도 있었지만

translation.en: And Reggie's given no indication that this is anything but final.
translation.ko: 레지 측에서는 은퇴 결정을 번복할 생각이 없어 보입니다

translation.en: [crowd chanting] Reggie! Reggie! Reggie! Reggie! Reggie! Reggie! Reggie! Reggie!
[Miller] Once all this happened,
that's when I was like, "It's time for me to hang it up."
translation.ko: 이런 생각이 들더군요 '이제 떠날 때가 됐다'

translation.en: [Jackson] If the brawl hadn't happened, we would have been champions. No question.
translation.ko: 난투가 일어나지 않았다면 우린 챔피언이 됐을 거예요

translation.en: That's the most fucked-up thing about it.
That's the only thing I regret about the whole situation,
translation.ko: 다른 건 후회 안 해도 그것만큼은 후회해요

translation.en: is not being able to do what we said we was gonna do for Reggie.
translation.ko: 레지와 우승하겠다고 한 약속을 지키지 못한 거요

translation.en: [Miller] It was bittersweet because so many emotions run through your mind.
translation.ko: 시원섭섭했어요 온갖 감정이 머릿속을 스쳐 지나가더라고요

translation.en: It was, like, fast forward 18 years.
That's your last NBA game ever.
[voice breaking] It's special, man. It's pure and special.
It is.
[voice breaking] For 18 years,
I've truly been blessed…
…to be a Pacer and a Hoosier.
Yeah, it's painful. Uh…
For me, it's painful. He did about everything you could do.
translation.ko: 적어도 제게는요 레지는 할 만큼 했거든요

translation.en: I apologize for that,
because there's no reason why, uh, Reggie,
translation.ko: 전 레지에게 미안해요 왜냐면 레지는… 챔피언 반지를 받을 자격이 충분히 있었거든요

translation.en: uh, should be sitting home without a ring.
translation.ko: 챔피언 반지를 받을 자격이 충분히 있었거든요

translation.en: [Artest] The Indiana jersey I had on
was projected on television at my worst moment.
translation.ko: 제 인생 최악의 순간에 입고 TV에도 나온 옷이죠

translation.en: So, wearing it, I wanna hide.
translation.ko: 그래서 그걸 입으면 숨고 싶은 기분이에요

translation.en: I didn't wanna ever play in an Indiana jersey. Too much pressure.
translation.ko: 부담이 너무 심해서 그 저지를 입고 활동하기 싫었어요

translation.en: I asked to be traded, 'cause like I said, I don't confront things head-on.
translation.ko: 그래서 트레이드를 요청했죠 전 문제가 생기면 피하거든요

translation.en: But I think it'd be best if I move on, and then, you know, they can move on.
translation.ko: 제가 떠나서 이 일을 잊어야 동료들도 잊을 수 있고

translation.en: You know, everybody can move on with their careers.
translation.ko: 그래야 다들 선수 생활을 이어 갈 수 있겠죠

translation.en: [Jackson] That was a slap in my face.
After all we'd been through the last year, now you wanna leave us?
translation.ko: 한 해 동안 같이 고생했는데 우릴 떠나겠다고?

translation.en: That had a lasting effect with me and Ron.
translation.ko: 그 일로 저와 론의 관계는 완전히 깨졌어요

translation.en: You gotta be accountable for the people that you pulled in.
translation.ko: 자기 일에 휘말리게 했으면 책임을 져야죠

translation.en: And to me, that was the most coward scenario
I've ever fucking seen in my life.
Sometimes you're a coward and you gotta admit it. Boom. Simple.
translation.ko: 살다 보면 비겁해질 때가 있죠 저도 인정해요

translation.en: You know, and, yeah, I didn't… I should've…
What you do in a moment like that is call your teammate,
translation.ko: 전 그때 팀원들에게 전화를 돌려야 했어요

translation.en: even if it's really uncomfortable.
So, yeah, I wish that would have happened.
It took a long time to figure out what's wrong.
translation.ko: 제 문제를 알아내기까지 오랜 시간이 걸렸어요

translation.en: At 23 years old, if I had more balance, I probably would have been really great.
translation.ko: 23살에 인생의 균형을 잡았다면 더 좋은 결과가 있었겠죠

translation.en: Ron Artest, by the way, uh…
Ron Artest of the Los Angeles Lakers had some big news today.
translation.ko: LA 레이커스의 론 아테스트가 오늘 큰일을 치렀습니다

translation.en: Ron actually filed papers to have his name legally changed to Metta World Peace.
translation.ko: 이름을 '메타 월드 피스'로 바꿀 신청서를 제출했다고 하는군요

translation.en: -Ridiculous. It reminds me of Prince… -So dumb.
translation.ko: - 어이없네요, 프린스가 생각나요 - 너무 바보 같아요

translation.en: …becoming the Artist Formerly Known as Prince. How long did that symbol last?
After the brawl, I told my therapist, "All I wanna do is have balance."
translation.ko: 사건 이후로 제 치료사에게 말했어요 '인생의 균형을 잡고 싶어요'

translation.en: "That's it. I don't care about nothing else."
I tried not to have that much emotional attachment to the game.
translation.ko: 그 뒤로 농구에 감정적으로 집착하지 않기로 했어요

translation.en: That's Buddhism, right?
You know, and Metta's a Buddhist name.
You wanna keep attaching yourself to as many positive things as possible.
translation.ko: 최대한 긍정적인 것들에만 마음을 두려고 노력하죠

translation.en: When you look at my career,
not being a good teammate, like, Metta's the opposite.
translation.ko: 전 좋은 팀원이 아니었지만 메타는 그 반대예요

translation.en: Be a good friend, be love, and be kindness.
translation.ko: 좋은 친구가 되고 사랑하고, 친절을 베풀고

translation.en: I wanna communicate, I wanna be a better person. You know?
translation.ko: 저도 남들과 소통하고 싶고 나은 사람이 되고 싶어요

translation.en: And that's pretty much what Metta means.
translation.ko: 저도 남들과 소통하고 싶고 나은 사람이 되고 싶어요 그게 '메타'의 의미예요

translation.en: I had a real problem with Ron for years,
and it grew a dislike in my system.
I was probably even more angry once he won the championship.
translation.ko: 론이 챔피언십에서 우승하자 분노는 더욱 커졌죠

translation.en: [commentator] Ron Artest has made the most of his second chance.
translation.ko: 론 아테스트가 두 번째 기회를 놓치지 않았습니다

translation.en: And he's come all the way from that Palace brawl
to NBA championship with the Los Angeles Lakers.
Ron, you're the only member of this Laker team
to get that first championship. You, my friend, are a champion. How does it feel?
translation.ko: 이번이 첫 번째 우승입니다 기분이 어떠세요?

translation.en: I was supposed to get one with Jermaine and Donnie and Larry
translation.ko: 원래 인디애나에 있을 때 저메인과 도니, 래리

translation.en: and Jamaal Tinsley and Jeff Foster over there in Indiana,
translation.ko: 자말 틴슬리, 제프 포스터와 우승했어야 하는데

translation.en: and I bailed out on them. I feel like a coward.
I don't even like being in their presence. I feel like a coward in their presence,
translation.ko: 제 비겁함이 떠올라서 그 친구들을 만나지도 못해요

translation.en: you know, 'cause I bailed out on them as a teammate.
translation.ko: 제가 팀원들을 저버렸거든요 그러고 나서 이렇게 우승했는데…

translation.en: And then I get to get a championship, you know, so…
Let's talk about this game. You looked in the first half…
I'm over the situation. I lost a lot of money. Whatever.
translation.ko: 전 그 일을 잊었어요 돈은 많이 날렸지만요

translation.en: I still feel like Jermaine's being labeled by that.
translation.ko: 하지만 저메인은 아직도 그 일로 욕을 먹고 있죠

translation.en: Jermaine O'Neal. [small laugh]
He was on the verge of becoming one of the greatest players ever. You know?
translation.ko: 그때 저메인은 정상급 선수로 인정받기 직전이었어요

translation.en: [Walsh] When I look at Jermaine today,
I think he probably suffered more than all the players.
Because Ronnie Artest ended up with the Lakers and won a championship.
translation.ko: 론은 결국 레이커스에 가서 챔피언십 우승을 달성했죠

translation.en: Even Jack, who had played on a championship team, San Antonio.
So Jermaine's career kinda got short-circuited.
translation.ko: 반면에 저메인의 경력은 잘 풀리지 않았어요

translation.en: The responsibility of carrying that team and being the leader was on him
translation.ko: 그 일이 일어났을 때 저메인은 팀의 리더로서

translation.en: when all that happened, and it wasn't his fault.
But he got blamed for it.
I've never really tried to use the word "regret,"
but…
it's a part of me
that, uh, has always bothered me.
Sky 4 was over the Palace of Auburn Hills earlier today,
where crews were beginning to demolish the place.
[newswoman] The Palace was home to the Detroit Pistons and saw three NBA championships
before it closed for good after the 2017 season.
[O'Neal] This thing was drawn out for years.
[O'Neal] I didn't wanna talk to anybody. I wanted to move on with my life.
translation.ko: 더는 얘기하고 싶지 않았고 그저 잊고 싶었지만

translation.en: I've never been able to get away from it though.
People thought that ticket guaranteed them to do whatever they wanted to do.
translation.ko: 티켓을 산 사람들은 뭐든 해도 된다고 생각했어요

translation.en: They can act and treat people any way they wanted.
translation.ko: 자기 멋대로 행동하고 사람을 막 대해도 된다고요

translation.en: I'm not saying much of it was correct,
but they had a personal investment in-in those ballplayers.
[O'Neal] Pops up every single year.
Kids that wasn't even born asking me about that.
translation.ko: 그때 안 태어났던 애들도 그 얘기를 물어봐요

translation.en: [Smith] Fans have such an emotional investment in it.
There is a darkness there.
[commentator] If you're a professional athlete, you may not go into the stands.
translation.ko: 프로 선수라면 관중석에 들어가선 안 됩니다

translation.en: Boy, what a waste of a lot of time and resources
when crimes and murders were taking place.
translation.ko: 더 심각한 범죄와 살인 사건이 있었는데도요

translation.en: Nobody cared about who won the criminal cases,
translation.ko: 형사 소송은 누가 이겼고 항소는 누가 이겼는지

translation.en: who won the appeal case.
I wasn't able to speak for years.
This is the last fucking time you can ask me about this shit.
translation.ko: 그 일에 대해 질문받는 것도 이번이 마지막이에요

translation.en: I don't wanna talk about that piece of shit motherfucker who threw that beer.
translation.ko: 그 맥주 던진 개자식 얘기는 하고 싶지 않다고요

translation.en: Okay? I don't wanna talk about losing all that money no more.
translation.ko: 내가 잃은 돈 얘기도 하기 싫어요

translation.en: [commentator] This is a disgrace.
If there's any fault, it's on me. I thought it would work.
translation.ko: 제 잘못이 있다면 팀이 잘 굴러갈 줄 알았는데

translation.en: I wasn't right.
[commentator] Fans and players are going at it. The players…
Some things just never leave.
They never leave.
Malice in the Palace is… is one of those events.
translation.ko: 팰리스의 난투극도 그런 일들 중 하나죠

translation.en: There's a bit of me that probably to this very day
is still in the Palace until they knock it down.
translation.ko: 계속 남아 있을 거예요 팰리스가 철거될 때까지는요
